intro: Horkelia tenuisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, dry habitats, such as slopes and gravelly soils. Its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves are adapted to arid environments. Horkelia tenuisecta produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
